contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Yabu |JapaneseName= 養父市 |MapImage= Yabu in Hyogo Prefecture Ja.svg |Region= [[Kansai]] |Prefecture= [[Hyōgo Prefecture|Hyōgo]] |District= |Area_km2= 422.70 |PopDate= February 29, 2012 |Population= 26,879 |Density_km2= 63.59 |Coords= {{coord|35|24|N|134|46|E|region:JP_type:city}} |LatitudeDegrees = 35 |LatitudeMinutes = 24 |LatitudeSeconds = |LongtitudeDegrees = 134 |LongtitudeMinutes = 46 |LongtitudeSeconds = |Tree= [[Fagus crenata]] |Flower= [[Lysichiton camtchatcensis]] |Bird= |SymbolImage= Flag of Yabu Hyogo.JPG |SymbolDescription= Flag |Mayor= Kaoru Umetani |CityHallPostalCode= 667-8651 |CityHallAddress= 1675, Yoka, Yoka-chō, Yabu-shi, Hyōgo-ken |CityHallPhone= 079-662-3161 |CityHallLink= [http://www.city.yabu.hyogo.jp/ City of Yabu] }} {{nihongo|'''Yabu'''|養父市|Yabu-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Hyōgo Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. As of February 29, 2012, this city estimate [[population]] is 26,879 people, with 9,761 [[household]]s, and a [[population density|density]] of 63.59 persons per km². The total area is 422.70 km². The city was formed on April 1, 2004 from the merger of all four towns of the former [[Yabu District, Hyōgo|Yabu District]]: [[Sekinomiya, Hyōgo|Sekinomiya]], [[Oya, Hyōgo|Oya]], Yabu (town), and [[Yoka, Hyōgo|Yoka]]. [[Image:Hyonosen02s1760.jpg|thumb|none|352px|Mt.Hyonosen, Hyonosen International Ski resort]] ==External links== {{Commons category-inline|Yabu, Hyogo|Yabu, Hyōgo}} * [http://www.city.yabu.hyogo.jp/ Yabu official website] {{ja icon}} {{Hyogo}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yabu, Hyogo}} [[Category:Cities in Hyōgo Prefecture]] {{Hyogo-geo-stub}}
